column4: I joined @SteveDaines in urging the Treasury to give tribes more time to use the Coronavirus Relief Fund so they can complete their most significant pandemic response projects, including the construction of health care facilities & improvement of water infrastructure.

I introduced a bill today to modernize @VAVetBenefits's digital benefits platform so student veterans no longer experience disruptions to their education benefits. As we work to combat the fallout of this virus, this update is more critical than ever.  https://t.co/pzVSVhPRsJ

Every veteran is impacted by their service differently. My bill will allow veterans to seek innovative therapies to combat PTSD and other mental health issues.
https://t.co/AYaS3k7L9j

Reminder that there are refundable payroll tax credits available to small and mid-sized businesses to reimburse them, dollar-for-dollar, for the cost of providing employee leave related to the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/IGZgzM6rzK

Arizonans living with chronic diseases often face cost barriers in getting the medical care they need. Our bipartisan bill would allow individuals with high deductible health plans to exercise greater flexibility and better manage their health at lower costs.
I‚Äôm urging the @DeptVetAffairs to expand vital telehealth care at VA facilities to support our veterans.

On #NationalFarmersDay, we recognize the Arizonans responsible for putting food on our tables. Thank you for all you do! I‚Äôve fought for relief for our farmers throughout this pandemic and will continue to do so. https://t.co/gIREudOpyI

One of the best steps Congress can take to better protect our seniors right now is to pass my bill to provide increased personal protective equipment and COVID-19 testing to our senior care facilities.

Telehealth has become an increasingly vital to Arizonans during this crisis. Since March, I‚Äôve worked to permanently expand telehealth services so Arizonans can stay connected to their health care providers. https://t.co/EE1CdSbCHV
My prayers are with Rep. Sierra and his family as they battle this virus. https://t.co/zEs6uYgtco

ICYMI: I introduced a bill to prevent catastrophic wildfires by restoring Arizona‚Äôs forest health. My bill incentivizes the removal of dangerous overgrowth and promotes low-carbon biomass energy development.

Since it was created in 1997, the Special Diabetes Program for Indians has shown great success in reducing the rate of type 2 diabetes in tribal communities while improving overall health. Thank you to @lisamurkowski for cosponsoring my bill to reauthorize this important program. https://t.co/Nbtgasiifq

A @SenFinance report this week confirms what we already know‚Äîwe must do more to protect Arizona seniors during this pandemic. One of the best steps Congress can take is to pass my bill with @ChuckGrassley and @SteveDaines. More ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/DFipRwal2q

Now let's pass critical Association Health Plan legislation to help small biz owners get affordable insurance for them, their employees, and their families, many with pre-existing conditions, who can't afford health insurance under ACA!

Clean energy development in Arizona is creating a brighter, healthier future for our country. Last year, I visited AZ's Palo Verde Nuclear Generating Station, our nation's largest nuclear plant, where Arizona is investing in our low-carbon future. #CleanEnergyWeek https://t.co/yLr1K2KFlL

Great news: @DeptVetAffairs awarded a suicide prevention grant to the Vietnam Veterans of California nonprofit, which operates in Northern Arizona. This grant will go toward reducing homelessness and supporting veterans‚Äô mental health. https://t.co/ZbWKlpjjSI

This ambush and assassination attempt of 2 LA deputies is despicable. As are the protestors blocking the ER entrance at the hospital yelling: "We hope they die." What is wrong with these people? My prayers are with the deputies and their families as they fight for their lives.

We must continue to provide AZ schools with the resources they need to provide the best quality education to our kids as we work to defeat this virus. Federal CARES Act funds I secured have allowed AZ schools to purchase needed technology and PPE.
https://t.co/eQAdpdvYgB

The gridlock demonstrated by today‚Äôs partisan vote is exactly why Americans are frustrated w/ Washington. COVID-19 knows no party lines & I‚Äôd ask Congress to come together in a bipartisan way to defeat this virus.

Far too many veterans survive war only to come home and take their own lives. As a veteran, I‚Äôm calling on the House to quickly pass this bill to get needed mental health resources to vets in crisis.

Our bill will bring desperately needed relief to these struggling families by providing electricity to Navajo households.
